title: Caravan no. 64
testimonial: I encountered children with diseases that could have been diagnosed right after birth or at least during the first years of life - somewhere there must have been a rupture between them and the health system. Before judging any of the parties involved (doctors or patients), I believe that any help they can get is a step forward. And it would be a shame not to help when possible. Elena-Lia Spoială MD, pediatrics resident

title: Caravan no. 58
testimonial: Saturday's Caravan was a true sentimental mountain rousse. With every Caravan, I find myself sad when I awknowledge the lack of health education in some communities, but at the same time I am happy that there are still people who are concerned about changing this.I hope there will be enough enthusiasm and energy for at least a hundred more editions.Oana Burnaru - president of Societatea Studențească de Stomatologie Iași (Dentistry Students' Society Iași)

title: Caravan no. 57
testimonial: Even if the physical energy can decrease dramatically at the end of the day, the period following the caravan is incredible, as you learn to trust yourself and your medical skills. The state of mind that you have after helping so many people doesn't compare to anything.Corina Varlam, Caravana cu Medici Iași volunteer

title: Caravan no. 52
testimonial: The satisfaction I felt when helping the patients is enormous. We do not feel it very often during our daily jobs because of all the rushing and the struggling with the bureaucracy and we forget that there is this beautiful part to the medical profession.Andreea Teodorescu MD, gastroenterology resident
